chargeHist.descr: Drive or Operate Vehicle w/o Consent

result.execSummary:
The defendant Damian D. Rice was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Take/Drive Veh. w/o Consent-Abandon Veh., a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 943.23(3m).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes:
Court costs remitted
Concurrent with: Rock County sentence

judgments.action: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

charges.dispoDesc: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Damian D. Rice

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.

records.addlTxt:
5:09 p.m. Plea/Sentencing - Defendant Damian D. Rice in court, in custody, with attorney John E Voorhees. Michael Schiek, D.A., appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Schiek speaks to agreement. State moves to amend to misdemeanor 943.23(3m); granted by the Court. Defendant pleads no contest. Plea questionnaire & waiver filed. Court reads on waiver of rights and tendering plea; waiver free & voluntary. Court finds factual basis for plea exists and finds defendant guilty of 943.23(3m). Schiek/Voorhees statement to sentencing. Court statement. Writ quashed by the Court.

Court sentence
9 mos. county jail, concurrent with current Rock County sentence
CC/DNA surcharge remitted
Appeal Rights
Initial appearance on February 10, 2015 at 03:00 pm.
States Reply to Discovery  and State's Demand for Discovery

02:16 pm - Attorney John E. Voorhees in court.  Steven Mitchell Michlig appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Michlig requests a status conference concerning resolution.  Status conference scheduled for January 12, 2015 at 03:30 pm.
Per Denise, DA's office, defendant transported to DCI - will schedule at a later date.

02:19 pm - Attorney John E. Voorhees in court.  Steven Mitchell Michlig appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Voorhees expected defendant to appear, however may be in custody Marathon County.  Parties request adjournment.  Initial appearance scheduled for November 24, 2014 at 01:30 pm.

Defendant Damian D. Rice not in court.  Jodie L. Bednar appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
2:04
